get.summary: Returns Bible Filesets which have Audio timestamps
get.description:
This call returns a list of hashes that have timestamp metadata associated
               with them. This data could be used to search audio bibles for a specific term, make
               karaoke verse & audio readings, or to jump to a specific location in an audio file.

204.description: No timestamps are available at this time

get.summary: Returns audio timestamps for a specific word
get.description:
This route will search the text for a specific word or phrase and return a
     *         collection of timestamps associated with the verse references connected to the term

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The specific fileset to return references for

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The tag for which to return timestamps

get.summary: Get a list of bible equivalents
get.description:
Fetch a list of bible equivalents filtered by Type, Organization or Bible.
     *         This route will allow your apps to connect to other Bible APIs and services without
     *         introducing duplicate Bible content into your apps and ease migration between APIs.
Returns a list of bible filesets

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: If provided will filter the results by the given book

parameters.name: chapter_id
parameters.description: If provided will filter the results by the given chapter

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: If provided will filter the results by the given Asset

put.description: A list of all the file types that exist within the filesets

get.description: Returns a an entire fileset or a selected portion of a fileset for download

200.description: The requested fileset as a zipped download

get.description: An audio Fileset in an RSS format suitable for consumption by iTunes

200.description: The requested fileset as a rss compatible xml podcast

get.description: A fileset's copyright information and organizational connections
A list of all the file types that exist within the filesets

parameters.name: fcbh_id
parameters.description: An alternative query name for the bible id

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: If set, will filter results by the type of media for which filesets are available. For a complete list of available media types please see the `/bibles/filesets/media/types` route

externalDocs.description: For a complete list of available media types please see the v4_bible_filesets.types route

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language to filter results by

parameters.name: language_name
parameters.description: The language name to filter results by. For a complete list see the `/languages` route

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The iso code to filter results by. This will return results only in the language specified. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: language_family_code
parameters.description: The iso code of the trade language to filter results by. This will also return all dialects of a language. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The owning organization to return bibles for. For a complete list of ids see the `/organizations` route

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The any field to within the bible model may be selected as the value for this `sort_by` param.

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: The direction to sort by the field specified in `sort_by`. Either `asc` or `desc`

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset_id to filter results by. At the moment there are two buckets provided `dbp.test` & `dbs-web`

parameters.name: filter_by_fileset
parameters.description: This field defaults to true but when set to false will return all Bible entries regardless of whether or not the API has content for that biblical text.

get.summary: Returns the books of the Bible
get.description: Returns all of the books of the Bible both canonical and deuterocanonical

get.summary: Returns the books of the Bible
get.description: Returns the books and chapters for a specific fileset

parameters.name: fileset_type
parameters.description: The type of fileset being queried

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id to select the fileset by

get.description: V4's base fileset route

get.summary: Run a text search on a specific fileset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of search results to return

get.summary: Returns the asset paths currently being used by the api

get.description:
Returns the oAuth providers being used by a project. This route can inform
     *         developers about the potential login options provided to users by each project.

post.summary: Add a new oAuth provider to a project

requestBody.description: Information supplied for oAuth Provider creation

get.summary: Returns the projects currently using the DBP
get.description: Returns the projects currently registered that aren't labeled as sensitive

post.description: It is recommended that you create a distinct project_id for each app using the API

get.summary: Get the details for a project

put.summary: Update the details for a project

post.description: Associate a social media account with a different user.

requestBody.description: Information supplied for user account creation

provider_id.description: Store a newly created resource in storage.

provider_user_id.description: Store a newly created resource in storage.

get.summary: Returns a list of bookmarks for a specific user

post.summary: Create a brand new bookmark for a specific user
post.description: Returns filtered permissions for a fileset dependent upon your authorization level and API key

put.summary: Update an existing bookmark for a specific user

delete.summary: Delete a new bookmark from a specific user

get.summary: Get a list of highlights for a user/project combination
get.description:
The bible_id, book_id, and chapter parameters are optional but
     *          will allow you to specify which specific highlights you wish returned.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who created the highlights

parameters.name: bible_id
parameters.description: The bible to filter highlights by

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The book to filter highlights by

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter to filter highlights by

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of highlights to include in each return

parameters.name: prefer_color
parameters.description:
Choose the format that highlighted colors will be returned in. If no color
     *          is not specified than the default is a six letter hexadecimal color.

get.summary: Get a list of Notes for a user/project combination
get.description: Query information about a user's notes

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who created the note

parameters.name: bible_id
parameters.description: If provided the fileset_id will filter results to only those related to the Bible

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: If provided the USFM 2.4 book id will filter results to only those related to the book

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of highlights to return

parameters.name: paginate
parameters.description: When set to false will disable pagination

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who created the note

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who created the note

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who created the note

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user who is creating the note

post.summary: Reset the password for a user
post.description:
This route handles resetting the password for a user that is a member of the project id provided
     *          If the password is known to the your users you can reset their passwords without the requirement to send
     *          them a verification email by setting the optional fields `password` and `new_password` fields within the
     *          request.

token_id.description: The token sent to the user's email

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The user ID for which to retrieve info.

requestBody.description: Information supplied for updating an existing user
Either the `email` & `password` or the `social_provider_user_id` & `social_provider_id` are required for user Login

get.summary: Geolocate a user by their Ip address

get.description:
Returns a list of the world's known scripts. This route might be useful to you if you'd like to
     *     you if you'd like to query information about fonts, alphabets, and the world's writing systems. Some fileset
     *     returns may not display correctly without a font delivered by these via the `alphabets/{id}` routes.
Returns a single alphabet along with whatever bibles and languages using it.
Returns the List of Countries

parameters.name: l10n
parameters.description:
When set to a valid three letter language iso, the returning results will be localized in
     *                       the language matching that iso. (If an applicable translation exists).

parameters.name: has_filesets
parameters.description: Filter the returned countries to those containing languages that have filesets

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Filter the returned countries to only those containing filesets for a specific asset

parameters.name: include_languages
parameters.description:
When set to true, the return will include the major languages used in each country.
     *                       You may optionally also include the language names by setting it to `with_names`

get.description: Returns a single Country
Returns the List of Languages

parameters.name: iso
parameters.description: The iso code to filter languages by

parameters.name: language_name
parameters.description: The language_name field will filter results by a specific language name

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The sort_by field will order results by a specific field

parameters.name: has_bibles
parameters.description: When set to true will filter language results depending whether or not they have bibles.

parameters.name: has_filesets
parameters.description:
When set to true will filter language results depending whether or not they have filesets.
     *              Will add new filesets_count field to the return.

get.description: Returns a single Language
This route returns the vernacular numbers for a set range.

get.summary: Return a all Alphabets that have a custom number sets
get.description: Returns a range of numbers

get.summary: Return a single custom number set
get.description: Returns a range of numbers

v4_api_assets.title: The assets response
v4_api_assets.description: The aws assets currently being used by the api

id.title: id
id.description: The Archivist created Bible ID string. This will be between six and twelve letters usually starting with the iso639-3 code and ending with the acronym for the Bible

date.title: date
date.description: The year the Bible was originally published

derived.title: derived
derived.description: This field indicates the `bible_id` of the Scriptures that the current Scriptures being described are derived. For example, because the NIrV (New International Reader's Version) was created from / inspired by the NIV (New International Version). If this model was describing ENGNIRV the derived field would be ENGNIV.

copyright.title: copyright
copyright.description: A short copyright description for the bible text.

in_progress.title: in_progress
in_progress.description: If the Bible being described is currently in progress.

versification.title: versification
versification.description: The versification system for ordering books and chapters

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was last updated

BibleBook.title: Bible Book
BibleBook.description: The Bible Book Model stores the vernacular book titles and chapters

name.title: name
name.description: The name of the book in the language of the bible

name_short.title: name_short
name_short.description: If the vernacular name has an abbreviated form, it will be stored hre

chapters.title: chapters
chapters.description: A string of the chapters in the book separated by a comma

BibleEquivalent.title: BibleEquivalent
BibleEquivalent.description: The Bible Equivalent Model stores the connections between the bible IDs and external organizations

type.title: type
type.description: The type of connection that the equivalent id refers to

site.title: site
site.description: The name of the site/organization/app where the equivalent id is based

suffix.title: site
suffix.description: Additional metadata affecting the type of equivalent connection

constructed_url.title: Constructed Url
constructed_url.description: The full path to the resource which the equivalent describes

BibleFile.title: BibleFile
BibleFile.description: The Bible File Model communicates information about biblical files stored in S3

id.title: id
id.description: The id

chapter_end.title: chapter_end
chapter_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple chapters this field indicates the last chapter of the selection

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse at which the BibleFile reference begins

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple verses this value will indicate the last verse in that reference. This value is inclusive, so for the reference John 1:1-4. The value would be 4 and the reference would contain verse 4.

verse_text.title: verse_text
verse_text.description: If the BibleFile model returns text instead of a file_name this field will contain it.
verse_text.example: And God said unto Abraham, And as for thee, thou shalt keep my covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee throughout their generations.

duration.title: duration
duration.description: If the file has a set length of time, this field indicates that time in milliseconds

BibleFileTimestamp.title: Bible File Timestamp
BibleFileTimestamp.description: The Bible File Timestamp tag model partitions the file into verse by verse sections

id.title: file_id
id.description: The incrementing id of the file timestamp

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse for the file timestamp

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: The ending verse for the file timestamp

timestamp.title: timestamp
timestamp.description: The ending verse for the file timestamp

BibleFileTitle.title: BibleFileTitle
BibleFileTitle.description: The Bible File Title model communicates information about generalized fileset sizes

file_id.title: file_id
file_id.description: The incrementing id of the file timestamp

iso.title: iso
iso.description: The translation language of the title

description.title: description
description.description: The description of the file title

id.title: id
id.description: The fileset id

hash_id.title: hash_id
hash_id.description: The hash_id generated from the `bucket_id`, `set_type_code`, and `id`

asset_id.title: asset_id
asset_id.description: The asset id of the AWS Bucket or CloudFront instance

set_type_code.title: set_type_code
set_type_code.description: The set_type_code indicating the type of the fileset

set_size_code.title: set_size_code
set_size_code.description: The set_size_code indicating the size of the fileset

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp at which the fileset was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the fileset was last updated

hash_id.title: hash id
hash_id.description: The hash value for the created fileset

BibleFilesetSize.title: BibleFilesetSize
BibleFilesetSize.description: The Bible fileset size model communicates information about generalized fileset sizes

id.title: id
id.description: The id

name.title: name
name.description: The name

BibleFilesetTag.title: BibleFilesetSize
BibleFilesetTag.description: The Bible fileset tag model communicates general metadata about the filesets

name.title: name
name.description: The name of the tag, serves as the key/category

description.title: description
description.description: The content of the tag, serves as the value of the key value pair of name/description

admin_only.title: admin_only
admin_only.description: If the tag is only to be visible to admin / archivist users

BibleFilesetType.title: Bible Fileset Type
BibleFilesetType.description: The Bible Fileset Type model communicates general metadata about the bible_filesets.set_size_code

Book.title: Book
Book.description: The Book model communicates information about the canonical books of the Bible

id.title: id
id.description: The USFM 2.4 id for the books of the Bible

synodal_order.title: synodal_order

german_order.title: german_order

kjva_order.title: kjva_order

vulgate_order.title: vulgate_order
vulgate_order.description: The standard book order for the `vulgate_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

lxx_order.title: lxx_order
lxx_order.description: The standard book order for the `lxx_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

orthodox_order.title: orthodox_order
orthodox_order.description: The standard book order for the `orthodox_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

nrsva_order.title: nrsva_order
nrsva_order.description: The standard book order for the `nrsva_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

catholic_order.title: catholic_order
catholic_order.description: The standard book order for the `catholic_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

finnish_order.title: finnish_order
finnish_order.description: The standard book order for the `finnish_order` in ascending order from Genesis onwards

testament_order.title: testament_order
testament_order.description: The standard book order within a testament in ascending order from Genesis to Malachi, and Matthew to Revelations

book_testament.title: book_testament
book_testament.description: A short code identifying the testament containing the book

book_group.title: book_group
book_group.description: An english name for the section of books that current book can be categorized in

name.title: name
name.description: The English name of the book

notes.title: notes
notes.description: Any archivist notes about the book

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp for the books creation

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp for the last update of the book

name.title: name
name.description: The translated name of the biblical book

name_long.title: name_long
name_long.description: The long form of the translated name

name_short.title: name_short
name_short.description: The short form of the translated name

name_abbreviation.title: name_abbreviation
name_abbreviation.description: The abbreviated form of the translated name

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp that the translated name was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp that the translated name was last updated

ON.title: Old and New Testament
ON.description: The translated string for the combined testaments of the bible

OT.title: Old Testament
OT.description: The translated string for the old testament of the bible

NT.title: New Testament
NT.description: The translated string for the new testament of the bible

AP.title: Apocrypha
AP.description: The translated string for the collected apocryphal books

VU.title: Vulgate
VU.description: The translation string for the Vulgate

ET.title: Ethiopian Orthodox Canon/Geez Translation Additions
ET.description: The translation string for the Ethiopian Orthodox order for books of the bible

CO.title: Coptic Orthodox Canon Additions
CO.description: The translation string for the Coptic Orthodox order for books of the bible

AO.title: Armenian Orthodox Canon Additions
AO.description: The translation string for the Armenian Orthodox order for books of the bible

CS.title: Codex Sinaiticus
CS.description: The translation string for Codex Sinaiticus

Gen.title: Genesis
Gen.description: The translation string for the book Genesis

Video.title: VideoTranslations
Video.description: The Video model holds information about biblical films. It serves as a wrapper for all Video{Value} Models including VideoTags and VideoTranslations.

VideoTag.title: VideoTags
VideoTag.description: The VideoTags model holds miscellaneous information about the video model.

id.title: id
id.description: The incrementing id of the video tag

id.title: Country Iso 3166-1
id.description: The Country ID for the country aligning with the ISO 3166-1 standard

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the Iso Registration Authority

iso_a3.title: Country Iso 3166-3
iso_a3.description: The Country iso for the country aligning with the ISO 3166-3 standard

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the Iso Wiki

fips.title: FIPS ID
fips.description: The Country id for the country aligning with the FIPS standard of the United Nations

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the FIPS Wiki

continent.title: continent ID
continent.description: The continent code for the country

name.title: Country Name
name.description: The name for the country in English

introduction.title: Country introduction
introduction.description: A brief description of the country in English
introduction.example: The landlocked Principality of Andorra is one of the smallest states in Europe, nestled high in the Pyrenees...

country_id.title: continent ID
country_id.description: The continent code for the country

CountryCommunication.title: Country Communication
CountryCommunication.description: The Country Communication Model stores information about the communication infrastructure of a country as reported by the CIA's World Factbook

fixed_phones_total.title: fixed_phones_total
fixed_phones_total.description: The `fixed_phones_total` field indicates the approximate number of phones utilizing landlines within a country

fixed_phones_subs_per_100.title: fixed_phones_subs_per_100
fixed_phones_subs_per_100.description: The `fixed_phones_subs_per_100` field describes the approximate number of landline phone subscriptions per 100 people. This gives a sense of the prevalence of landline phone use within a population.

mobile_phones_total.title: mobile_phones_total
mobile_phones_total.description: The `mobile_phones_total` field describes the total approximate number of cellphones within a country

mobile_phones_subs_per_100.title: mobile_phones_subs_per_100
mobile_phones_subs_per_100.description: The `mobile_phones_subs_per_100` field describes the total approximate number of cellphone subscriptions within the country per 100 people. This gives a sense of the prevalence of cellphone use within a population.

phone_system_general_assessment.title: phone_system_general_assessment
phone_system_general_assessment.description: The `phone_system_general_assessment` field describes the general state of the telephone system within the country.
phone_system_general_assessment.example: Sparse system of open-wire, radiotelephone communications, and low-capacity microwave radio relays

phone_system_international.title: phone_system_international
phone_system_international.description: The `phone_system_international` field indicates the international phone code and satellite position for a country.

externalDocs.description: For a full list of country phone codes please refer to Wikipedia

phone_system_international.example: country code - 257; satellite earth station - 1 Intelsat (Indian Ocean) (2015)

phone_system_domestic.title: phone_system_domestic
phone_system_domestic.description: This field gives a general assessment of the status of the domestic phone system.
phone_system_domestic.example: Fixed-line teledensity of only about 6 per 100 persons; mobile-cellular teledensity approaching 50 per 100 persons

broadcast_media.title: broadcast_media
broadcast_media.description: This field indicates the independence and connections between the different companies that operate within the country
broadcast_media.example: 4 state-controlled national TV channels; Polish and Russian TV broadcasts are available in some areas...

internet_country_code.title: internet_country_code
internet_country_code.description: The TLD extension, Top Level Domain, for the country

externalDocs.description: For a full list of top level domains

internet_total_users.title: internet_total_users
internet_total_users.description: The number of people who have access to the internet.

internet_population_percent.title: internet_population_percent
internet_population_percent.description: The percent of the populace who have access to the internet

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The created_at timestamp for the Communications Model

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The updated_at timestamp for the Communications Model

CountryEconomy.title: Country Economy
CountryEconomy.description: The Country Economy Model stores information about the economic status of a country as reported by the CIA's World Factbook

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: A general overview of the countries economic status.
overview.example: Afghanistan's economy is recovering from decades of conflict. The economy has improved significantly since the fall of the Taliban regime in 2001 largely because of the infusion of international assistance, the recovery of the agricultural sector, and service sector growth...

gdp_power_parity.title: GDP (purchasing power parity)

externalDocs.description: For a detailed list of countries and their PPP GDP see:

gdp_power_parity.example: $64.08 billion (2016 est.) ++ $62.82 billion (2015 est.) ++ $62.35 billion (2014 est.)

household_income_highest_10.description: Household income or consumption by percentage share; highest 10%

electricity_production.title: Electric Production
electricity_production.description: The total kilowatt production for the country.

electricity_consumption.description: The total kilowatt consumption for the country.

electricity_hydroelectric.description: The total generating percentage of the current electric systems that are based on hydroelectric systems.

electricity_renewable.title: electricity_renewable

highlight_start.title: highlight_start
highlight_start.description: The number of words from the beginning of the verse to start the highlight at. For example, if the verse Genesis 1:1 had a `highlight_start` of 4 and a highlighted_words equal to 2. The result would be: In the beginning `[God created]` the heavens and the earth.

highlighted_words.title: highlighted_words
highlighted_words.description: The number of words being highlighted. For example, if the verse Genesis 1:1 had a `highlight_start` of 4 and a highlighted_words equal to 2. The result would be: In the beginning `[God created]` the heavens and the earth.

The v4 highlights index response. Note the fileset_id is being used to identify the item instead of the bible_id.
    This is important as different filesets may have different numbers for the highlighted words field depending on their revision.

format.description: Setting this param to true will add format the return as a specific file type. The currently supported return types are `xml`, `csv`, `json`, and `yaml`
